messages: 3e06fa3927cbdf4e9d93ba4541acce86 (16:31): Wow. We're losing one of our best devs to Youtube
41bd7e32a1e29a94d86120e9f87ed56f (16:48): Does anyone know if Chrome ask to user for permission when a website wants to store files in the application cache?

1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555 (16:53): q. how to detect if firefox support webgl ? !!window.WebGLRenderingContext return true even if webgl is not available... im trying around document.createElement('canvas').getContext('experimental-webgl') but no success so far
3e06fa3927cbdf4e9d93ba4541acce86 (16:55): 1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555, Are you in the webgl email group?
1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555 (16:55): 3e06fa3927cbdf4e9d93ba4541acce86: nope
3e06fa3927cbdf4e9d93ba4541acce86 (16:56): if (window.WebGLRenderingContext) { } usually
3e06fa3927cbdf4e9d93ba4541acce86 (16:56): Or so I thought
3e06fa3927cbdf4e9d93ba4541acce86 (16:58): 1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555, look at this thread: https://www.khronos.org/webgl/public-mailing-list/archives/1012/msg00263.html
1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555 (16:58): 3e06fa3927cbdf4e9d93ba4541acce86: yeah but doesnt work on chrome10 and ff4
1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555 (16:58): 3e06fa3927cbdf4e9d93ba4541acce86: looking
4d027150f7b41873cdaf6ced5ee1ab59 (16:59): whats a good converter to convert wmv to mpeg4?

3fa179c2d34f53c18e7551ac493014d9 (16:59): 41bd7e32a1e29a94d86120e9f87ed56f I don't know off-hand - never been prompted to opt-in to it - but i've got chrome right here if you want to point me to a site with cache-manifest and I'll tell you what happens

1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555 (17:00): 3e06fa3927cbdf4e9d93ba4541acce86: this one seems close try { var support = !!document.createElement('canvas').getContext('experimental-webgl'); }catch(e){ var support = false}; console.log("support", support);
3fa179c2d34f53c18e7551ac493014d9 (17:00): 4d027150f7b41873cdaf6ced5ee1ab59, good tutorial on web video here: http://diveintohtml5.org/video.html, lists a bunch of options
3e06fa3927cbdf4e9d93ba4541acce86 (17:00): Yeah looks like there is no defacto standard for webgl
41bd7e32a1e29a94d86120e9f87ed56f (17:01): 3fa179c2d34f53c18e7551ac493014d9: Can you give this Web page a try? http://demos.hacks.mozilla.org/openweb/todo/
3e06fa3927cbdf4e9d93ba4541acce86 (17:01): 1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555, Check out Modernizr's WebGL test: http://www.modernizr.com/
41bd7e32a1e29a94d86120e9f87ed56f (17:01): I have Chrome as well but I might have clicked "allow forever" or something
3fa179c2d34f53c18e7551ac493014d9 (17:01): 41bd7e32a1e29a94d86120e9f87ed56f - no prompt for permission, and I can confirm that the resources did get cached
41bd7e32a1e29a94d86120e9f87ed56f (17:01): Good, thank you
3fa179c2d34f53c18e7551ac493014d9 (17:02): maybe there's a setting in the config that changes it, but if there is I haven't touched it, this is basically the default configuration
1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555 (17:03): 3e06fa3927cbdf4e9d93ba4541acce86: doesnt seem good https://github.com/Modernizr/Modernizr/blob/master/modernizr.js#L375
3e06fa3927cbdf4e9d93ba4541acce86 (17:04): aha
3e06fa3927cbdf4e9d93ba4541acce86 (17:05): 1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555, Good explanation though
1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555 (17:07): 3e06fa3927cbdf4e9d93ba4541acce86: yep. https://gist.github.com/917600 the one i will use
3e06fa3927cbdf4e9d93ba4541acce86 (17:08): nice
06f8cd0b658fdc771166556364335603 (17:18): hello all.. is this tthe appropriate place to be asking a canvas question? im dying here :)
06f8cd0b658fdc771166556364335603 (17:23): can you make canvas see through? at least in some parts of it? like i wanna be able to see the divs that are behind it
15fad03d7cb0ee8d21fed396e8a403a5 (17:24): sure 06f8cd0b658fdc771166556364335603 there is no default background color on canvas
15fad03d7cb0ee8d21fed396e8a403a5 (17:24): just do not draw where you want it transparent
06f8cd0b658fdc771166556364335603 (17:25): ok .. but.. if i draw something .. can i substract from it ? and make it transparent again?

06f8cd0b658fdc771166556364335603 (17:26): for example... im trying to modify the ambilight thingy .. i dont know if u know it... a video embedded that generates left and right 2 canvases filled with a linera gradient top bottom based on colors sampled from the edge of the video...
15fad03d7cb0ee8d21fed396e8a403a5 (17:26): clearRect() method should be what you need

06f8cd0b658fdc771166556364335603 (17:27): the problem is that in order to make it look like "lights" coming out of a screen... the maker just put an alpha png on top of the canvas and it only works if in the background of the page u have a constant color
06f8cd0b658fdc771166556364335603 (17:28): clearRect() .. ist here a clearShape?
15fad03d7cb0ee8d21fed396e8a403a5 (17:30): don't know about that (does not mean no)
15fad03d7cb0ee8d21fed396e8a403a5 (17:30): have you checked the doc ?
15fad03d7cb0ee8d21fed396e8a403a5 (17:30): spec*
06f8cd0b658fdc771166556364335603 (17:34): maybe im doing something wrong.. but if i use clearRect() it clears the space but .. its left blank .. black.. not red as is the body background color :((
15fad03d7cb0ee8d21fed396e8a403a5 (17:39): pastebin your code
15fad03d7cb0ee8d21fed396e8a403a5 (17:40): I won't be able to help you much anyway :-/
